Classical.Structure: A small endocrine gland located in the epithalamus, near the center of the brain. Composed primarily of pinealocytes. It is unique for being one of the few brain structures outside the blood-brain barrier.
Classical.Function: Produces and secretes melatonin, the primary hormone that regulates circadian rhythms (sleep-wake cycles). It receives photoperiod information from the retina via the suprachiasmatic nucleus (SCN) and sympathetic nervous system.
Classical.Pathology: Pineal cysts, pineal tumors, and progressive calcification (which may impact melatonin production and sleep quality).
